title: India's delayed $5-trillion dream: What IMF‚Äôs new timeline means for your wallet; impact on EMI, taxes
content: India's $5 trillion economy target has been pushed to 2028-29, primarily due to currency depreciation and lower-than-expected nominal GDP growth. While the real economy continues to grow, this delay impacts imported goods, foreign education costs, and potentially government finances, urging a focus on long-term financial planning over political timelines.

title: IND vs SA: Hardik Pandya goes full throttle in 5th T20I; hits 16-ball fifty
content: Hardik Pandya made an immediate impact in Ahmedabad. He hit a six off his first ball, which struck a cameraman. Pandya then smashed three sixes and two fours in one over. He reached his half-century in just 16 balls. Pandya was dismissed after scoring 63 runs off 25 balls. India won the match.

title: SIR showdown: Over 97 lakh voters deleted in poll-bound TN; 14.2 lakh in Chennai alone
content: Tamil Nadu's draft electoral roll after the SIR has 5.43 crore voters. The SIR exercise removed over 97 lakh names. The exercise, opposed by chief minister MK Stalin, aimed to ensure accuracy but drew criticism for potentially deleting legitimate voters. Similar revisions are under way in West Bengal, which lakhs of voters were deleted.

title: Google cofounder Larry Page predicted AI revolution in 2000; what he said
content: A resurfaced 2000 video shows Google co-founder Larry Page accurately predicting the future of AI-driven search. He envisioned an "ultimate search engine" that would understand user intent and provide direct answers, a capability now realized by Gemini models. Page acknowledged the company was far from this goal then but was committed to incremental progress, leveraging vast data and computational resources.

title: U19 Asia Cup: India beat Sri Lanka in semi-final; to face Pakistan in title clash
content: India Under-19 secured a spot in the Asia Cup final. They defeated Sri Lanka U19 by eight wickets in a rain-affected semi-final. Vihaan Malhotra and Aaron George guided India to victory after bowlers restricted Sri Lanka. India will now face Pakistan in the final, their first meeting in an Asia Cup final in eleven years.

title: 'No agreement': Sidda rejects power-sharing theory; K'taka CM row intensifies
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has dismissed claims of a two-and-a-half-year power-sharing arrangement within the state government. He asserted that he will remain CM until the party high command decides otherwise, refuting opposition questions about a potential leadership change. Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar also denied rumors of a dinner meeting, emphasizing party unity.

title: Warner Bros-Netflix deal: WBD wants Oracle founder‚Äôs backing
content: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has rejected Paramount Skydance's $108 billion hostile takeover bid, deeming it "misleading" and "inadequate." WBD's board urged shareholders to reject the offer, citing financial concerns and a lack of a strong personal guarantee from Larry Ellison. The company reiterated its preference for a merger agreement with Netflix, which it considers superior and more transparent.

title: Randi Mahomes thanks fans after Patrick Mahomes‚Äô knee surgery message
content: Patrick Mahomes‚Äô mom sends message after Chiefs QB‚Äôs surgery as the Kansas City quarterback begins rehab following a torn ACL and LCL. Randi Mahomes thanks fans for prayers and support while Patrick Mahomes shares an emotional response to the injury. Here is what the Mahomes family said and what the timeline looks like for the Chiefs moving forward.

title: SHANTI, but not quiet: How India is rewriting rules of nuclear energy
content: Parliament has passed the SHANTI Bill, 2025, opening India's civil nuclear sector to private and foreign investment for the first time. This landmark law aims to boost clean energy, enabling a significant increase in nuclear capacity and attracting substantial investment. The bill overhauls governance, redefining liability and establishing the AERB as an independent safety regulator.

title: Meta AI‚Äôs highest-paid employee unhappy; calls management 'suffocating'
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: SIR in Gujarat: Nearly 74 lakh names deleted from rolls; EC opens window for objections
content: Gujarat has removed nearly 74 lakh names from its electoral rolls, reducing the total voter count from 5.08 crore to 4.34 crore. This extensive clean-up, part of the Special Intensive Revision exercise, targeted deceased, absent, and duplicate voters. The updated draft rolls are now public, with a deadline of January 18 for objections and claims.

title: US' BlueBird satellite launch on December 24: Isro
content: India's space agency ISRO is set to launch a US commercial satellite, 'BlueBird Block-2', on December 24th using its LVM-3 rocket. This mission highlights India's growing prowess in space, capable of launching large satellites for global leaders. The advanced satellite aims to provide high-speed cellular broadband to smartphones worldwide.

title: 'Bat him at No. 3‚Äô: Former India batter makes strong case for Sanju Samson ahead of T20 World Cup
content: With the T20 World Cup approaching, India's batting dominance has waned, marked by a drop in strike rate and uncertainty in the opening combination. While past success was built on aggressive intent, recent struggles from key players like Suryakumar Yadav and Shubman Gill raise concerns about team balance and leadership form.

title: Inside Josh Allen‚Äôs luxury car collection: Bills QB‚Äôs impressive garage
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: Bret Hart & Stephanie Washington net worth 2025: Wrestling legacy and assets
content: Bret Hart, known as "The Hitman," has amassed a net worth of $7 million through his successful wrestling career with WCW and WWE, merchandise, and royalties. He married his third wife, Stephanie, in 2010, and their joint assets include their Alberta home. Despite a significant age gap, Stephanie has supported Hart through his health challenges.

title: Arber Xhekaj, Adam Engstrom shine as Canadiens beat Blackhawks
content: The Montreal Canadiens secured a 4-1 victory over the Chicago Blackhawks, with Zachary Bolduc scoring twice. The team's defense showed promising chemistry, particularly the Arber Xhekaj and Adam Engstrom pairing, which fans are advocating to keep. This defensive adjustment, alongside Bolduc's offensive surge, provides a potential solution for the Canadiens as they face a challenging upcoming road trip.

title: IND vs SA: Umpire down! Sanju Samson's rocket shot hits official ‚Äì Watch
content: In the match between India and South Africa,  there was a concerning moment that saw umpire Rohan Pandit getting struck on the knee by a powerful Sanju Samson shot. Play paused as medical staff attended to the official. India were in a dominant position at 95/1 in the ninth over when the incident occurred.

title: Vaping, woof & shouting match: Viral moments from Parliament Winter Session - watch
content: The Lok Sabha's 19-day Winter Session concluded with a productivity of 111 percent, marked by the passage of key bills like the Viksit Bharat‚ÄìGuarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill. The session witnessed heated debates, protests, and viral moments, including accusations of vaping, a Congress MP bringing a puppy, and unruly scenes during bill passages.

title: Trump and the art of adding your name next to Kennedy
content: Donald Trump has never been a president comfortable with abstraction. His idea of power is tactile. You can walk through it, host a dinner in it, point to it from across the street. This is why his second term has been accompanied not just by policy reversals but by an unusual fixation on physical space.

title: Vijay Hazare Trophy: Rohit Sharma to play in first 2 matches
content: Rohit Sharma will play Mumbai's first two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches, while Suryakumar Yadav, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Shivam Dube are absent. Shardul Thakur will captain the squad, which also includes Sarfaraz Khan and his brother Musheer. Ajinkya Rahane will rest due to a hamstring issue.

title: School paradox: Govt enrolment dominates even as thousands of classrooms empty
content: India‚Äôs government schools still educate most children, but the system is increasingly mis-sized. In 2024‚Äì25, over 65,000 government schools reported zero or near-zero enrolment, even as teacher postings stayed intact. In several states, private schools now enrol more students than government schools. The data points to misalignment, not collapse‚Äîenrolment shifts faster than consolidation and redeployment.

title: Taiwan: 2 killed in smoke grenade, knife attacks at Taipei metro stations
content: At least eight people were injured in Taipei's metro system following smoke grenade and knife attacks. Three individuals suffered cardiac arrest, with one suspect also in critical condition after falling from a building. Investigations are ongoing into the motive behind the incident, prompting increased security measures across Taiwan.

title: Over half NCERT posts vacant as zero hiring for 2 years, Parl data shows crisis
content: Parliamentary data from the Ministry of Education has revealed that over half of the sanctioned posts at NCERT and its constituent bodies remain vacant. With no recruitment carried out for two consecutive years, staffing shortages are most severe in Group B and Group C posts. The organisation has increasingly relied on contractual staff to manage operations. Similar patterns of negligible permanent recruitment were also reported at NCTE and NIOS.

title: What is Bravo Eugenia? Jerry Jones‚Äô $250mn superyacht named after his wife
content: Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones commissioned the $250 million superyacht, Bravo Eugenia, a stunning tribute to his wife, Eugenia. This opulent vessel, designed by Nuvolari Lenard and Reymond Langton Design, reflects a deep love and family involvement in its creation. Jones envisions exploring the world from its decks, creating lasting memories.

title: Betting case: ED attaches assets of Yuvraj, Urvashi Rautela, ex-MP Mimi Chakraborty
content: The Enforcement Directorate has seized assets worth Rs 7.93 crore in a crackdown on the illegal betting platform 1xBet.  Action has been taken against several celebrities, including cricketers and actors, for promoting the platform through surrogate brands.  These endorsements involved payments routed through foreign entities to conceal illegal funds derived from betting activities.

title: Hindu man lynched in B'desh: Yunus govt firefights; vows to punish perpetrators
content: Bangladesh's interim government condemned the lynching of a Hindu man and widespread violence following the assassination of poll contender Sharif Osman bin Hadi. Urging citizens to resist mob violence, the Yunus-led government vowed perpetrators would not be spared, emphasising the upcoming elections as a national commitment and supporting targeted journalists.

title: IND vs SA: Why Samson replaced Gill in India's XI for Ahmedabad T20I
content: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed at the toss that Gill was unavailable due to a "niggle". Sanju Samson was selected in place of Gill.

title: B Praak welcomes baby boy: Singer shares joy and gratitude on Instagram
content: On December 1, 2025, the talented singer B Praak and his beloved wife Meera Bachan celebrated a special milestone as they welcomed their precious baby boy. Taking to Instagram, the ecstatic couple shared their joy and gratitude with their fans, sparking an outpouring of love and congratulations from their dedicated followers.

title: U19 Asia Cup: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi fails in semi final against Sri Lanka; departs cheaply
content: India's Under-19 Asia Cup campaign faced a setback in the semi-final against Sri Lanka. Star batter Vaibhav Sooryavanshi was dismissed early. Sri Lanka posted 138 runs. India struggled in their chase of 139 in the rain-affected match. The winner will proceed to the final.

title: Winter Session ends: Decoding 19 days of chaos; key bills passed, debates missed
content: The Lok Sabha's Winter Session concluded after 19 days, marked by disruptions and sharp political clashes. Despite passing eight key bills, including those on insurance FDI and nuclear energy, crucial debates on air pollution and electoral reforms were overshadowed. The session ended with both Houses adjourned sine die, leaving significant issues unresolved.

title: Tristan Jarry injury update: Oilers goalie exits after getting hurt
content: Edmonton Oilers goaltender Tristan Jarry left the game against the Boston Bruins after a slide across the crease appeared to injure his lower body. Backup goaltender Calvin Pickard took over in the net. Head coach Kris Knoblauch confirmed that Jarry‚Äôs condition will be reviewed by medical staff, with the severity of the injury still unclear.

title: Quote of the day by Leo Tolstoy: 'I often think men don‚Äôt understand‚Ä¶'
content: Leo Tolstoy, a renowned author and philosopher, explored profound themes of personal transformation and societal hypocrisy. His timeless quotes, like "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself," emphasize the importance of inner change.

title: Weeks after abandoning Pakistan tour, SL sacks Asalanka from captaincy
content: "Shanaka's role will be of an all-rounder. When I stopped being a selector, Shanaka was the captain. Charith (Asalanka) was in our long term plans then," Wickramasingha said.

title: GM at 13, India's Raunak still struggles to have full-time coach ‚Äî Exclusive
content: Raunak Sadhwani became a chess Grandmaster in 2019 at just 13, among India‚Äôs youngest to do so. Now 19 and ranked eighth among juniors, he reflects on the high cost of professional chess. Despite lacking a full-time coach, Raunak is competing at the top level as he prepares for the upcoming World Rapid and Blitz Championships.

title: GOAT Tour: Messi's visit shows India loves football icons ‚Äî just not Indian Football
content: Lionel Messi‚Äôs India tour exposed a stark paradox: Indians passionately celebrate global football icons but neglect their own game. While crores were spent on celebrity appearances, Indian football leagues struggle for survival, sponsors, and audiences. The frenzy highlighted misplaced priorities, where social media clout outweighs sustaining domestic football, leaving Indian players, clubs, and the sport itself at a crossroads.

title: Ex-gym trainer kicks toddler playing badminton on Bengaluru road
content: A incident unfolded in Thyagarajanagar, South Bengaluru, where a 35-year-old gym trainer allegedly kicked a five-year-old boy playing badminton. The unprovoked assault, captured on CCTV, left the child with injuries. Police have registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, with the accused reportedly undergoing psychiatric treatment.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Hindu man lynched, body tied to tree and set on fire
content: A Hindu man was beaten to death and his body set ablaze in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district following blasphemy allegations. This incident occurred amidst broader unrest, including attacks on media institutions and protests following the death of a student leader, raising concerns over minority safety and press freedom.

title: 'Might appoint Pandya': Gill not to be vice-captain for T20 WC?
content: Aakash Chopra believes Shubman Gill will likely continue as vice-captain for the T20 World Cup 2026, despite recent form concerns. However, he acknowledges that the team management might keep the position open or consider Hardik Pandya. Chopra also revealed his India squad, highlighting Abhishek Sharma and Varun Chakaravarthy as potential top performers.

title: Travis Kelce sparks childhood nostalgia with reveal of original Pok√©mon cards
content: In a New Heights podcast promo, Travis Kelce excitedly opened a Pok√©mon Gold Pack, sparking a playful debate with his brother Jason about their childhood fandom. Travis's childlike wonder and humorous comment about a "Medicham" card having a "BBL" had fans in stitches, with many requesting the segment return weekly.

title: Live-in relationships not illegal, says Allahabad HC; grants police protection to 12 couples
content: The Allahabad High Court ruled that live-in relationships are not illegal, granting protection to 12 couples facing threats. Justice Vivek Kumar Singh emphasized that adults in such relationships are entitled to life and liberty, directing police to provide immediate security after verifying age and voluntary cohabitation.

title: Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill: New institutional architecture of higher education
content: India‚Äôs higher education system has expanded fast, but regulation has stayed cluttered and uneven. This column explains how the Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, 2025 tries to fix that by creating one apex body and three linked councils for regulation, accreditation, and standards, with outcomes and public transparency at the centre. The promise is graded autonomy with accountability.

title: Decoding Noam Chomsky's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein
content: This is not a story about crimes. There is no evidence linking Noam Chomsky to Jeffrey Epstein‚Äôs sexual offences. That boundary should not be blurred. But this is very much a story about power, judgement, and proximity. About how elite worlds function. About how influence circulates. And about how even those who devote their lives to critiquing systems of domination can misread them when they arrive dressed as conversation.

title: Our guide to every Week 16 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: Must-win game for Lions? Can Dallas still make the postseason? We have picks, predictions and stats for every game.

title: Canes' Allen out for season after cancer diagnosis
content: Miami sophomore forward Marcus Allen has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma and will miss the remainder of the season.

title: Underdog Paul being bet heavily to beat Joshua
content: Despite being a 7-1 underdog, Jake Paul has attracted 82% of the bets and 90% of the money wagered at DraftKings for his fight against former heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua.

title: Sources: Rockets expand talks to buy, move Sun
content: Rockets ownership is in substantive talks with the Connecticut Sun over the potential purchase and relocation of the WNBA franchise to Houston, sources told ESPN

title: Puka dominates, rips refs again to cap chaotic day
content: After apologizing for a gesture that was "antisemitic in nature" earlier Thursday, Puka Nacua had one of the best games of his career and afterward criticized officials on social media.

title: Ohio: Smith fired over affair with student, drinking
content: In an intent to terminate letter, Ohio University's president wrote that football coach Brian Smith's "extramarital affairs," including one with a student, brought "disrepute, scandal and ridicule," which violated his employment agreement.

title: McVay: Reversed 2-point call not one I've seen
content: Rams coach Sean McVay questioned a crucial 2-point conversion that allowed the Seahawks to tie Thursday night's score midway through the fourth quarter, saying after Los Angeles' 38-37 OT loss that he had "never quite seen anything like what happened."

title: Bickerstaff says ref Goble entered game with bias
content: Pistons coach J.B. Bickerstaff sounded off on official John Goble, saying his calls during Thursday night's game against the Mavs were "not objective."

title: üèà 2026 NFL draft: Five-team race for No. 1 pick
content: The Raiders, Browns, Titans, Giants and Jets are front-runners for the No. 1 pick. What would they do with the top selection?

title: How different is Pete Golding from Lane Kiffin? Start with social media and yoga
content: After weeks of speculation and turmoil, the Rebels and their new coach are eager to get back on the field.

title: The decision that turned around the fortunes of Brent Venables and Oklahoma
content: On the hot seat after a losing season, the OU head coach returned to playcalling. The move created a vintage Sooners D.

title: NBA MVP straw poll: SGA and Jokic secured 99 votes -- who got the 100th?
content: SGA? Jokic? Cup MVP Jalen Brunson? We polled 100 media members in a ballot that mirrors the league's official vote.

title: 'That's going to probably piss off some pitchers': How MLB teams are approaching new ball-strike challenge system
content: The strategic side of baseball's next big rule change is already in motion. Here's the early thinking from MLB managers.

content: Which of the five basketball power conferences is more likely to produce this season's national champion?

title: Power Rankings: It's Arizona vs. Michigan for No. 1
content: The Wildcats and Wolverines are battling it out for the title of best team in the country. See the full top 25.

title: Coveted head coaching jobs that might come open this offseason
content: Which opening would be most attractive? Let's sort eight possible openings, starting with Cincinnati.

title: Did you know there are 13 active former No. 1 picks in the NFL? We examine them all
content: Matthew Stafford, Myles Garrett are having the best seasons of all 13 of the former No. 1 picks currently in the NFL.

title: Proof that Texas A&M volleyball's run is more methodical than magical
content: The Aggies reject the notion that their NCAA women's volleyball title game run is magical, or that they're riding momentum. They say it's by design.

title: On the racetrack or in the air, Greg Biffle will be remembered as a hero
content: Greg Biffle died in a plane crash Thursday in North Carolina, where he'll be remembered not only as a NASCAR star, but as a humanitarian, too.

title: Future Power Rankings: Long-term projections for all 20 teams
content: We ranked all 20 Premier League clubs' expectations for the next few years. Which teams are set up to thrive in the future?

title: Could Aston Villa be crowned Premier League champions?
content: Can third-place Aston Villa sustain a title challenge, and why are they like the 2024 Kansas City Chiefs?

title: Want to beat the Oklahoma City Thunder? This five-step guide tells you how
content: Using the Spurs' and Trail Blazers' wins over Oklahoma City as a blueprint, let's evaluate the most important factors of a Thunder loss.

title: Scandals, prediction markets: Is 2025 a turning point for sports betting?
content: Here are the stories that dominated sports betting's year -- and will continue to be battlegrounds in 2026.

title: Week 16 betting guide: Backing Maye to throw Patriots to a W
content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 16 and share their tips and bets.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the College Football Playoff
content: Who takes the top spot? Our college football experts rank the top 50 players from the College Football Playoff teams.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What WNBPA's move to authorize strike means for labor talks
content: The Jan. 9 deadline is still weeks away, but the WNBPA has voted to authorize calling a strike "when necessary" during negotiations.

title: Heading into her final Olympics, Hilary Knight's impact is as big as ever
content: The 2026 Winter Olympics will be Knight's last playing for Team USA. She remains one of the faces of U.S. women's hockey.

title: Ranking the top 10 freshmen by impact
content: USC's Jazzy Davidson tops our rankings also featuring Oklahoma's Aaliyah Chavez, UConn's Blanca Qui√±onez and more.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 16
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Why did Hamilton's debut season at Ferrari go sideways? Will it get any better in 2026?
content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari was supposed to be a dream come true, but it became a nightmare. Will 2026's regulation change make things right?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Al Hilal star Neves
content: Manchester United have been put on alert as Al Hilal midfielder R√∫ben Neves wants to return to the Premier League. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: BJP National Working President Nitin Nabin to¬†visit Patna on December 23
content: Bihar BJP President Sanjay Saraogi said that¬†BJP workers, along with the people of Patna and State, had been eagerly awaiting this day¬†and now the¬†wait is¬†finally¬†coming to an end.

title: Centre revises guidelines to help poor prisoners unable to pay fines, arrange sureties
content: Unhappy with the response from States and Union Territories, MHA directs jail officials to refer cases of poor prisoners and undertrials to District Legal Services Authority to facilitate release of financial assistance

title: Centre blames Opposition for stalling Parliament debate on pollution
content: As Winter Session ends, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju slams Opposition conduct and blames Congress for stalling Parliamentary debate on air pollution

title: Centre plans portal to take process of forest rights‚Äô recognition, management online
content: Tribal Affairs Ministry said the portal is proposed to act as a single window for all Forest Rights Act processes, which include filing and processing of claims, issuing digital title deeds, storing legacy data on titles granted

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan defends IFFK against censorship and Centre‚Äôs interference
content: Pinarayi Vijayan criticises the Union Ministry of Information and Broadcasting for denying censor exemptions to 19 films, labelling the actions as a direct assault on freedom of expression and a manifestation of ‚Äòanti-democratic‚Äô sentiments.

title: Corporations have a fundamental duty to protect ecosystem, prevent species' extinction: Supreme Court
content: Corporate duty must evolve from merely protecting shareholders; non-renewable power generators near the Great Indian Bustard‚Äôs habitats are ‚Äúguests in its abode‚Äù, must pay for in-situ and ex-situ conservation

title: DCC strikes deal with rebel winner to retain Thiruvambady panchayat
content: Jithin Pallat, who contested from Punnakkal ward as a rebel candidate and won with a margin of 535 votes, will be offered the post of president as part of a strategic compromise

title: West Bengal BJP flags violence in Bangladesh, Trinamool hits back
content: Since August 2024, when former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina had to flee the country, the West Bengal unit of the BJP has been highlighting the alleged violence and attacks against Hindus in Bangladesh

title: RJD accuses Jitan Ram Manjhi of winning elections by vote rigging
content: A purported video of the HAM(S) leader saying he had ‚Äòhelped‚Äô a party candidate win election has gone viral; Union Minister hits back at the Opposition, says the video had been doctored, ‚Äòhe is no longer afraid of anyone‚Äô

title: IBM to skill 5 million Indians in AI, cybersecurity, quantum computing by 2030
content: India possesses the talent and ambition to lead the world in AI & Quantum. Fluency in frontier technologies will define economic competitiveness, scientific progress and societal transformation, says IBM Chief Arvind Krishna

title: State Animal Welfare Board pushes for stricter stray dog vaccination measures in Kerala
content: The board also recommends bringing in amendments to the Kerala Panchayat Raj Act and the Kerala Municipalities Act to prevent pet dogs from being abandoned on the streets.

title: I have never been politically weak, asserts Siddaramaiah
content: Chief Minister on Thursday night had held a dinner meeting with some of his supporters in the home of Satish Jarkiholi

title: HC quashes GO allowing company to set up brewery at Elappully
content: Court observes that many aspects considered by the government while according preliminary sanction were not factually correct

title: V-C appointments gain momentum after Governor-CM talks; Opposition alleges ‚Äúsecret understanding‚Äù
content: Reports suggest a renewed push to make permanent appointments at all universities that have been helmed by interim V-Cs for several years

title: Live Updates: Indian Armed Forces Are NDTV‚Äôs Indian Of The Year 2025
content: NDTV will recognise and celebrate outstanding Indians across 14 diverse categories spanning business leadership, innovation, philanthropy, governance, sports, entertainment, culture, and science.

title: Mosquitoes Take Detour To Civic Body As Raipur Man Delivers Biting Protest
content: In a protest that was as sharp as the sting that triggered it, a young man in Chhattisgarh's capital literally carried his complaint to the authorities sealed in a plastic bag.

title: Battle For Breath: Mumbai's Elite Enclave Turns Pollution Hotspot
content: Air quality in and around Bhakti Park and Wadala Truck Terminal (TT) has plummeted in recent weeks, with AQI levels soaring beyond 300 - classified as "severe".

title: Indian Armed Forces Are NDTV Indian Of The Year 2025
content: Following a phenomenal display of valour, coordination and pinpoint precision during Operation Sindoor, the Indian Armed Forces have been named NDTV's Indian Of The Year for 2025.

title: Why Trump's US Green Card Lottery Ban Will Not Hurt Indians
content: In the wake of deadly shootings at Brown University and the MIT that killed three people and injured several others, US President Donald Trump has moved to halt the diversity visa programme, also known as the green card lottery.

title: Manvendra Shekhawat Wins Climate Impact Of The Year At NDTV Indian Of The Year
content: Manvendra Singh Shekhawat has been awarded the NDTV Indian Of The Year under the Climate Impact category, whose organisation Dhun has worked to transform 500 acres of barren land into an ecosphere.

title: Rights Body Takes Note As 5 Children Get HIV-Infected Blood In Madhya Pradesh
content: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has taken cognisance of the shocking case in which five children tested HIV positive after allegedly being administered infected blood during transfusions at government health facilities in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Jharkhand College Students Forced To Kiss At Gunpoint, Blackmailed for Money
content: Two college students in Jharkhand's Koderma district were assaulted, forced to kiss at gunpoint and then blackmailed for money with threats of making their videos viral.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla, G Madhavi Latha Named 'Science Icons Of The Year'
content: Two Indians whose work has taken the country to the frontiers of space and engineering were named 'Science Icons of the Year' at NDTV's Indian of the Year Awards 2025 on Friday.

title: Sunil Vachani Is 'Business Leader Of The Year' At NDTV Indian Of The Year
content: Sunil Vachani, chairman of Dixon Technologies, has been named the 'Business Leader of the Year' at NDTV's Indian Of The Year 2025.

title: UP Man, Sister Get Life Imprisonment Over 13-Year-Old Girl's Rape
content: A special POCSO court here on Friday convicted and sentenced a 24-year-old man and his married sister to life imprisonment over the rape of a 13-year-old girl in a five-year-old case, a case lawyer said.

title: Bhopal Contractor Loses Rs 30 Lakh In Online Game, Dies By Suicide: Police
content: A 32-year-old civil contractor allegedly died by suicide in his house in Bhopal on Thursday after losing nearly Rs 30 lakh in an online game, the police said.

title: 3 Killed In Smoke Grenade, Knife Attack In Taiwan Metro Stations
content: Attacks at metro stations in Taipei on Friday involving smoke bombs and stabbing killed at least three people, the fire department official said, adding that the suspect was also dead.

title: 42 Lakh Names To Be Dropped as First Phase Of SIR Ends In Madhya Pradesh
content: The first phase of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) drive aimed at updating the voter list in Madhya Pradesh was completed at midnight on Thursday and the preliminary draft electoral roll will be published on Tuesday, officials said.

title: A New Horizon: The India-Oman Trade Pact And The Threads Of Connection
content: In an age when economic landscapes shift like sand dunes beneath a relentless sun, the recent India-Oman CEPA emerges as a testament to the enduring spirit of collaboration amidst geopolitical uncertainties.

title: Russia Sends Over 1,000 Bodies To Ukraine, Receives 26 In Fresh Exchange
content: Ukraine and Russia have carried out a new exchange of bodies of dead soldiers, Ukrainian and Russian officials said on Friday.

title: Dozens Of Flights Cancelled, Roads Flooded As Rare Rainstorm Hits UAE
content: UAE airport authorities cancelled or delayed dozens of flights and roads were flooded in major cities as the heaviest rainstorm in months lashed the desert nation on Friday.

title: Luxury Cars, Property Papers Worth Rs 10 Crore Seized In Manipur By ED
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday carried out search operations at multiple locations across Manipur, seizing three luxury vehicles, property documents valued at around Rs 10 crore, along with other incriminating papers.

title: Year After Pregnant Kerala Woman Was Slapped In Police Station, Cop Suspended
content: Over a year after he pushed and slapped a pregnant woman inside a police station in Kochi, the then station house officer has been suspended.

title: SIT detains two persons of interest in the Sabarimala gold theft case for questioning
content: Persons in SIT custody include a Bengaluru-based jeweller and the owner of a metalworks factory in Chennai

title: Child trafficking and commercial sexual exploitation a ‚Äòdeeply disturbing reality‚Äô in India: Supreme Court
content: Top court emphasises that courts must not disbelieve the testimony of a trafficked child just because of minor inconsistencies in her evidence; says she must be treated as an injured witness, not accomplice

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF won 38.81% and LDF 33.45% of votes, show vote share data released by State Election Commission
content: While BJP-led NDA claims 14.71% of the votes, 13.03% of the votes went to other parties and Independents

title: New labour codes: Kerala to take the lead in pressuring Centre to protect workers‚Äô rights
content: At a national-level labour conclave in the State, it was decided that the State Labour Minister and Central trade union representatives will meet the Union Labour Minister soon, pointing out the anti-worker nature of the labour codes

title: Driverless train prototype for Bengaluru metro‚Äôs Pink Line to arrive at Kothanur depot soon
content: BEML earlier this year unveiled the prototype of its new driverless metro train developed for Namma Metro‚Äôs Phase-2 corridors, including Phase 2A and 2B

title: KIIFB masala bonds: Kerala HC reserves judgment on ED appeal against interim stay by single judge
content: Single judge issued interim stay on further proceedings in a plea filed by KIIFB challenging the ED notice, in connection with the use of funds generated through masala bonds for infrastructure development in the State

title: Watch: ECI deletes over 97 lakh voters in Tamil Nadu, 73 lakh in Gujarat
content: The Election Commission of India published draft electoral rolls for Tamil Nadu and Gujarat after the Special Intensive Revision, removing over 97 lakh voters in Tamil Nadu and 73.73 lakh in Gujarat.

title: IFFK 2025: Japanese film Two Seasons, Two Strangers wins Suvarna Chakoram
content: Argentine¬†filmmakers¬†Carina Piazza and¬†Luc√≠a¬†Bracelis¬†win¬†Rajatha¬†Chakoram¬†award for best director for the film¬†Before the Body

title: Tamil Nadu SIR draft electoral roll: How to check your name in voter list
content: The draft electoral roll for Tamil Nadu after the Special Intensive Revision was released on December 19, 2025

title: Chief Secretary calls for foolproof arrangements for Godavari Pushkarams in 2027
content: Directing the Collectors to prepare and submit detailed DPRs on various aspects, Vijayanand stresses need for using advanced technologies for handling massive crowds expected for the event

title: Ernakulam Collector sends Sabari rail land acquisition proposal to State
content: District Collector sent the proposal to Transport department seeking the administrative nod day after receiving requisition details from Railways

title: Marottichal Riju murder case: three accused sentenced to life imprisonment
content: Court awards life imprisonment and a fine of ‚Çπ3,10,000 on the second, sixth and seventh accused ‚Äî Sherry alias Kunjumon, Prakasan and Anoop

title: Parliament Winter Session: 8 out of 10 Bills tabled pass both Houses, two sent to Standing Committee
content: Clocking a productivity of 111%, Parliament passed crucial bills like SHANTI, Sabka Bima Sabka Raksha and two bills targetting tobacco factories

title: Pawan Kalyan holds one-to-one meetings with party MLAs
content: Discusses issues related to development of the respective constituencies and implementation of welfare schemes

title: Polavaram displaced families look to tide over livelihood crisis
content: Families allege that farming or fishing in their abandoned villages, even for temporary sustenance, has become nearly impossible due to the inaccessibility from the R&R colonies. Despite being pushed into penury, the families remain hopeful that the government will honour the entitlements in both letter and spirit

title: BJP gains in city, fails to make a mark in rural Kozhikode
content: The party could not improve its tally in municipalities and could win only 17 of the 1,343 wards in 70 grama panchayats

title: PM Modi highlights global collaboration at WHO Traditional Medicine Summit
content: ‚ÄúIt is India‚Äôs privilege and a matter of pride that the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine has been established in Jamnagar,‚Äù said the Prime Minister

title: CPI faces turmoil in Idukki, senior leader quits active politics
content: Former CPI district secretary K.K. Sivaraman says CPI leadership is moving in the wrong direction in Idukki and there is no space for self-criticism in the party. He says he will not hold any party posts in future. Conflicting reports emerge on the seats won by the party in the local body election

title: Kerala SIR: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan urges EC to avoid undue haste and include all eligible citizens on voter roll
content: There is a concern that large-scale exclusion from the voter roll is happening under the ‚Äòothers‚Äô category, says Pinarayi Vijayan.

title: ED seizes assets linked to YouTuber Anurag Dwivedi in ‚Äòillegal‚Äô betting case
content: The agency seized luxury vehicles worth over ‚Çπ4 crore and frozen movable assets valued at about ‚Çπ3 crore during searches at 10 premises in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh linked to Dwivedi

title: North Karnataka braces for cold wave, with Bidar logging the lowest minimum
content: Yellow alert has been issued for Bidar, Kalaburagi, Raichur, and Yadgir districts, warning of cold wave conditions and advising heightened preparedness

title: SC upholds man's will cutting off daughter for marrying 'outsider'
content: the HC and the trial court had doubted the will and allowed equitable partition of the property of her father . the plaintiff is found to have no claim over the properties of the plaintiff . a senior advocate appeared for Shyla, requesing the claim .

title: Why Congress should not ignore message of sacked Odisha leader
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: It's a disgrace that Jake Paul vs. Anthony Joshua is a sanctioned fight
content: Otto Wallin, 28, remains a world-class heavyweight, still toiling for that last best shot . he has been in the game for two full decades, turning pro in 2013, and has been stopped by only one man . the two-time unified heavyweight champion, former olympic gold medalist and among the division's hawthorns .

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Bo Nix and six other potential playoff heroes
content: the spectacle of the ring and the vibrant characters that bring it to life loom large over the zeitgeist . it's testament to brilliant marketing, engaging storytelling and continued commitment to craft . xFP leaderboard | xTD leaderboard .

title: Don't doubt Terence Crawford, even in his retirement from boxing
content: the undefeated boxer retires on his own terms . he's the undisputed champion at 140, 147 and 168 pounds . the great andre Ward left in 2017 after consecutive wins over the boogeyman .

title: 'I wish he was still here': Inside Klay Thompson's split from Golden State
content: Curry says it's a "natural instinct" for his eyes to follow Klay Thompson around the court . his son, Canon, delivered his "Hello, Klay" line that became a viral video representing the Splash Brother connection . he was resting at home with Canon, who is now 7 years old and slightly more aware of the complexities of the NBA world .

title: Power Rankings: Louisville in, UNC out of top 16
content: this week they make their debut in the ESPN women's college basketball Power Rankings . the Cardinals are now no. 16, the highest-ranked of the three ACC teams left in the AP poll . they play the Tennessee Lady Vols in Saturday's champions Classic doubleheader at barclays center .

title: Seahawks mount 16-point comeback, defeat Rams in OT to take over NFC West
content: the Seattle Seahawks beat the los Angeles Rams 38-37 in overtime to clinch a spot in the playoffs . the team looked like one of the best teams in the NFL while compiling an 11-3 record . it was all but written about how the seahawks would have to take the long road . they erased a 16-point deficit in the fourth quarter after the game was turning into a blowout foll .

title: First playoff Brawl of the Wild headlines FCS semifinal showdowns
content: a crowd of 27,340 watched Montana State play keep-away four weeks ago . the Grizzlies had just cut Montana State's lead to 31-28 with seven minutes remaining . but the visiting Bobcats moved the chains five times, including on fourth-and-1 and third-and-4 .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll, holiday gifts for each team
content: the Colorado Avalanche remain on top of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings . it's the holiday gifting season, which means what better time than now to hand out a gift to all 32 teams . a panel of commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday .

title: Quarterback Mensah returning to Duke next year
content: darian Mensah announced he would return to the blue Devils next season . he posted a video message to his Instagram account titled, "Let's run this back" he led Duke to the ACC championship earlier this month .

title: Connelly on the CFP first round: Game-by-game previews
content: the first round of last year's inaugural 12-team college football playoff was memorable primarily for the otherworldly atmospheres . the four home teams were favored by an average of 8.8 points but won by 19.3 . we might get a couple of those this time around, too .

title: Who will squeeze into the NFL playoffs? Let's simulate the rest of the season to find out
content: the Rams and the Broncos have clinched berths, but the remaining 12 postseason teams and the overall seedings remain a murky mystery . we asked the FPI to simulate the last three weeks of the season and come up with the most likely field of 14 playoff teams .
